War in Ukraine: Russia targets cities as Ukrainians strike energy infrastructure
subhead: While Russia has launched 574 Shahed drones against Ukraine, Kyiv has managed to hit Russian energy infrastructure, forcing Crimea to ration fuel at service stations.

In 'Kolkhoze,' Emmanuel Carrère becomes his mother's son
subhead: In his new book, the French author reflects on his often tumultuous relationship with his late mother, Hélène Carrère d'Encausse, and explores what he owes her. This major work addresses themes of death, love and writing.

headline: In Istanbul, soaring rents put the middle class under pressure
subhead: The cost of housing has spiraled out of control in the Turkish capital, driven by hyperinflation and the collapse of the national currency.

headline: Rugby Women's World Cup: The stakes for a 2025 edition driven by unprecedented enthusiasm
subhead: The World Cup, held in England, kicks off Friday with a match between the host team and the United States. International rugby authorities hope the tournament will mark a turning point for the sport.

headline: The books we accumulate but will never read are 'less a burden than a form of wealth'
subhead: 'Letters from America' (5/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams sees beauty in accumulating thousands of books in his library, knowing that a single lifetime would never be enough to read them all – a beauty found in an unexplored world.

In the Donbas, a Ukrainian high schooler's rebellion against Russification
subhead: At her Russian-controlled high school near Luhansk, a pro-Ukrainian teenager who resisted propaganda was the target of relentless disciplinary action since January. Fearing that she could be placed in foster care or even adopted, her mother decided to flee the occupied territory.

headline: AI, my students and me: 'Last semester marks the nadir of my experience in academia'
subhead: 'Letters from America' (1/6). The writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams has been startled by the omnipresence of artificial intelligence at university, which he believes threatens the very foundations of education and our ability to think.

headline: What is Kick, the platform on which a French streamer died live?
subhead: Raphaël Grave, known online as Jean Pormanove, died Monday during a livestream. The tragedy has shed light on a little-known streaming site and its extremely permissive moderation policies.
